result.execSummary:
The defendant Robin R. Schultz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided)  and pay surcharge.   
May not have contact with James Kirk, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  
*  Pay prosecution costs Joint/Several with 14CF54, 14CF55, 14CF56.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Richards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years w/conditions; submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Richards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads no contest.  Court finds deft guilty.  Prosecution costs ordered in the amount of $1,983 joint & several with 14CF54, 14CF55 & 14CF56 (by stipulation of deft).  PSI waived.  SEH 3/5/15 at 3:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Richards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Richards states they are working toward resolution of this case; the deft is working on getting into an employee assistance program.  Court withholds entry of prosecution costs that was previoulsy signed and will reconsider on a future date.  FPT continued to 2/12/15 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.
and order for other prosecution costs  -  Kenosha Count Div of Health $1983.00 total

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Richards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, FPT continued to 1/15/15 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Richards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  FPT adjourned to 12/4/14 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Richards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, FPT continued to 10/17/14 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Richards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Richards states he provided information to the State today that ADA Graveley needs time to review.  FPT continued to 9/25/14 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Richards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, FPT continued to 8/26/14 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Assistant District Attorney Zachary Wittchow, special prosecutor, appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Richards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, FPT continued to 7/8/14 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Richards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  This case is here based on Atty Caviale's motion to modify bond in case 14CF56.  No action taken; bond in file 14CF56 was not modified.
to modify bond; filed by Atty J Caviale.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Richards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Richards acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty plea.  DA PTC 5/16/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 6/19/14 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Mark Richards. Clerk LE. Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6 for arraignment on 4-3-14 @ 8:15am. Information to be filed within statutory time limits. Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing

1:17 pm    Attorney Angelina Gabriele appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Mark Richards.  Clerk:  LE.    Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Comm Mason on 3-19-14 @ 9:15 am.  $5000 signature set with conditions.

*Not to possess or consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Contact w/ James L K or his residence.  No discussion of this case w/ Nicholas K or Michelle K.  *TO SUBMIT TO BOOKING AND PROCESSING BY 4:00PM TODAY.
961.42(1) Maintaining Drug Trafficking Place, PTAC
Initial appearance rescheduled from 2-28-14 to 3-6-14 at 1:00pm at the request of Atty. Richards. DA's Office notified.

Initial appearance scheduled for 2-26-14 rescheduled with Atty. Mark Richards, as Frank Parise is filling in as commissioner this afternoon, and he represents a co-def. Initial appearance rescheduled to 2-28-14 @ 1:00pm. DA's Office notified.
